REPORT OF 1 AUDITOR br PUBLIC ACCOUNTS STATE OF NEBRASKA Auditing Office '•.'". ■ . Lincoln, Nebr., December 1, 1932 *fo the Honorable Charles W. Bryan, ' Governor of Nebraska, ■ ' '.'•••'■' Lincoln, Nebraska. Dear Governor: • • ' In compliance with Statute 4847, I take pleasure in presenting here - with my biennial report, covering the two years. from July 1, 1930 to June 30, 1932. The statement of the state's Liabilities and Resources as' required by Statute 4847 you will find statement No. 1, showing resources totaling $81,206,883.80 with no state indebtedness. This is $56,497.43 less than In 1930. • , .' *_.'.• ■- I call your attention to the condition of the State Treasury shown as Schedule 1A. The cash on hand In the State Treasury on June 30 193* totaled $5,075,155.23. which amount is $2,457,747.99 less than on June 30 1930. The General Fund" balance June 30, 1932,. after deducting outstand - ing warrants, was $1,834,082.34 as compared with $2,436,496.84 on June oil, 1930. - ■ , ' During the fiscal year ending June 30, 1922, 87365 warrants were written in this office, during the last fiscal year 166,192 warrants were written, an increase of practically 100% In the past ten years This increase in work has been taken care of with no Increase in the number of employees, during the past ten years. On the next page is a graph, showing the fluctuations in State's Revenues and Expenditures. •■;.'■'• SUBDIVISIONS REDUCE INDEBTEDNESS The bonds issued by the various subdivisions of the state during the Biennium July 1. 1930 tp June 30, 1932, totalled $13,306,195 as shown by statement No. 8. This is an increase of $1,215,520 compared with the preceding biennium. The bonded indebtedness of subdivisions, arranged by counties are Wn t ° n , S fl e^ ent 9 aDd the amoUnt Of bonds outstanding on June 30, 1932 totaled 1107,204,195, which is a reduction of $2,680,517 from the total outstanding two years ago. This reduction of indebtedness -is very -gratifying, indicating funda - mentally sound conditions in the State. Very respectfully yours, Geo. W. Marsh, GWM:DH ■:■-:;■ .-..•■. State Auditor. .. " ' \ ■
